title.narrative: Creating inclusive and natural water synergies in Khulna urban region

description.narrative: The ambition of Water as Leverage, as a program, is to become a one that generates multiple bankable climate resilience projects globally following this first Call for Action which serves as a pilot. Key elements for this collaborative pre-project preparation call is to include all stakeholders from the beginning; local governments, NGOs and businesses, international and local experts in the teams and partners with funding capacity for the proposals to be developed (i.e. development banks, public and private partners).Scheduled activities are divided into two (2) stages.Phase 1: Research and Analysis for the Development of Conceptual Designs:In this phase the teams develop three (3) to five (5) Conceptual Designs for potential solutions to the challenges, based on new and/or existing research and analysis.Phase 2: Development of Proposals for Urban Water Projects:In this phase up to three Conceptual Designs from Phase 1 are transformed into Proposals for Urban Water Project(s) with a focus on physical infrastructure. These should serve as solutions to the challenges in the cities.The objective is to develop bankable, innovative and comprehensive Proposals for Urban Water Projects in Khulna (Bangladesh) to address the urgent water and climate adaptation needs. The proposals should have local support, a focus on physical infrastructure and be developed with local partners.The following elements should be taken into account and are described in more detail in the document ‘Setting the Scene’, downloadable from www.waterasleverage.org:1) Proposals will be embedded in a complex planning context2) Comprehensive proposals that endorse strategies combining water and urban challenges3) Water as Leverage asks for processes that incorporate local expertise into concrete solutions with global resonanceFor more info, please visit; www.waterasleverage.orgWithin Khulna city the project proposals for creating inclusive and natural water synergies in Khulna urban region included the following components;Component 1 - Reducing flooding and water logging:– Rehabilitation and improvement of existing drainage network, including:• Rehabilitation and improvement of khals and drains which are directly connected to Mayur river.• Repairing of Alutola sluice structure.• Rehabilitation and reconstruction of cross culverts and 15 outfall structures on the Mayur.• Elevated embankments on both side of Mayur river and low-cost pumps at the end of each outfall so that water drains properly to Mayur river.• Removal of hyacinths and solid wastes from Mayur river to bring back Mayur to its natural course.• Undertake further studies to improve the drain connectivity inside the catchment area so that runoff water is drained properly to the bigger drains and consequently to the Mayur river.– Two new bridges to be constructed on Mayur for people and light vehicles.Component 2 - Optimizing storage: ponds and reservoirs:Under this component three different development packages were developed for different categories of existing urban ponds of which around 120 were identified for treatment:• Package 1 - Active management of government-owned ponds;• Package 2 - Revitalizing and improving institution-owned ponds; and,• Package 3 - Increasing production of privately-owned ponds.Component 3 - Sanitation and solid wasteThe key goal of the sanitation and solid waste components of the project are to ensure the maximum benefit and long-term sustainability of drainage interventions. As well as contributing to reduced flooding and waterlogging, improved sanitation and solid waste management will result in improved public health and local environment.Other local partners included; Khulna University of Engineering & Technology, Urban and Regional Planning (KUET-URP).
